div.p: When I was in my teens I was doing my GCSEs, well training to do my GCSEs, and given that I had to go into hospital
to get my tendons stretched I missed out on the training, I still got some GCSEs but not the ones I wanted. I spent a few months in hospital
which left me behind on my school work. I did try and catch up but unfortunately because it was a long period off, it was a few months,
because they basically had to cut the tendons in the back of my legs to stretch them, I couldn’t catch up but that’s one thing I regret really
is not getting the GCSEs I wanted unfortunately. In 2007 there was a massive flood in Tewkesbury and I lost my job,
I was in retail at the time, because of the time off and because of my house like being done up, we were actually living in a caravan at the time
and I went through a time of depression, strangely, but I went through a time of depression because a job for me is identity
and to lose a job is losing my identity and yeah I went through many months of depression and my dad at the time he’s always
been the yo-yo really and he said to me “right, stop feeling sorry for yourself, get out there and get a job” so yeah I became a security officer.
